comments_content.body:
Probably a case for **GMT_THEME**=_inverse_.
Yet, that W axis should be white like the test.

Interestingly, the basemap command work:

`gmt basemap -JX12c/8c -Baf -BWSen+tBLA -R-0.04/1.12/-0.04/1.04  --MAP_FRAME_PEN=thicker,white --PS_PAGE_COLOR=gray -png lixo`

So somewere we must be reverting to black before stroking.  Will look.

> Probably a case for GMT_THEME=inverse.

That's were it started (*dark* actually).

And if I take the ``darkmode.conf`` make it a ``gmt.conf`` and  run
```
printf "0.0 0\n1.1 1" | gmt plot -JX12c/8c -Baf -BWSen+tBLA -R-0.04/1.12/-0.04/1.04 --PS_PAGE_COLOR=gray -png lixo
```
then it cashes.

The crash occurs in ``gmtremote_data_load()``. It should not have to visit that function when plotting a local file.

```
printf "0.0 0\n1.1 1" | gmt plot -JX12c/8c -Baf -BWSen+tBLA -R-0.04/1.12/-0.04/1.04 --PS_PAGE_COLOR=gray -png lixo
```

Working to fix the initial problem and have done so and find my fixes reveals 4 new failures that are actually corrections.  One is mgd77/cm4.sh which I think you wrote.  In it, you plot 3 axes WSn and then you plot the E axis with a separate setting: --MAP_DEFAULT_PEN=+1p,red.  Per the documentation, the leading + means

`Prepend + to overrule the color of the parameters MAP_GRID_PEN_PRIMARY, MAP_GRID_PEN_SECONDARY, MAP_FRAME_PEN, MAP_TICK_PEN_PRIMARY, and MAP_TICK_PEN_SECONDARY by the color of MAP_DEFAULT_PEN`

This means MAP_FRAME_PEN shall be red as well and the axis red.  This is not in the orig, but my revision now paints it red.  I am just checking that this is what you wanted when you wrote that script, if so then I can update the PostScript toghether with 3 others.
Also, I may replace many of the extra AWK calls with GMT internal stuff (e.g, FORMAT_FLOAT_OUT=%.2lf instead of running awk to do taht.

Still on my my example, we get a warning
```
Your gmt.conf file (gmt.conf) may not be GMT 6 compatible
```
because the line 
```
else if (strlen (line) < 7 || (ver = strtol (&line[6], NULL, 10)) < 5 )
```
is triggered by this line in the ``darkmode.conf``
```
# Defaults file for darkmode theme
```

But above all, I'm finding that these problems are causes because ``gmt_begin()`` always calls ``gmtlib_refresh_server()`` that calls ``gmtremote_data_load()``. 

These is too intrusive and prone to give troubles. I don't think ``gmtlib_refresh_server()`` should be called by every GMT command. Loading a ``@file`` is a minor GMT feature and we should not condition all GMT commands to the risky shits that may happen with web access.

Honestly, I thought this was fixed a while ago.  I will see if I can reproduce.  There is no reason to refresh the server until a remote file is referenced.

But I need to finish the first color issue first.  OK with your East axes being red then?

The East is red to show that it's the axis for the red line in plot. What is it that you want to change (though it's just a test)?

> there is no reason to refresh the server until a remote file is referenced.

Yes but the point is that the check for a refreshing server should only be done when a remote file is referenced, not by all commands, as it happens now with that call being in ``gmt_begin()``

> The East is red to show that it's the axis for the red line in plot. What is it that you want to change (though it's just a test)?

I want to fix the bug that draws the line black despite the script requesting red.  It now draws red so I assume that is what you wanted.
Yes, it's a kind of poor plotyy

> Still on my my example, we get a warning
> 
> ```
> Your gmt.conf file (gmt.conf) may not be GMT 6 compatible
> ```

Well, it is not a stand-along gmt.conf file.  We could rename these themes to have another extension if that is confusing.  They are not meant to be used as such, but via --GMT_THEME=darkmode or gmt set GMT_THEME darkmode.

OK, the issue  is fixed by #4498 but I still get
```
Your gmt.conf file (gmt.conf) may not be GMT 6 compatible
Your gmt.conf file (gmt.conf) may not be GMT 6 compatible
```
when using ``darkmode.conf`` as a local ``gmt.conf``

>  They are not meant to be used as such, 

Why? It has valid set of settings.
And the warnings are triggered by the a comment line, which is not right.

But no headers etc as gmt.conf files do. Surely, you do not plan to do

`cp gmt-dev/share/theme/darkmode.conf ~/gmt.conf
`

to use the themes, with all the OS-specifics as well?
FYI, the headers and version stuff in gmt.conf is generated by GMT code while the themes files are static text.

> Surely, you do not plan to do ... ``cp ...``

Just did that to check if the failures were the same as in my ``theme()`` function in Julia.
I understand since the themes branch is not finalize yet.  But faking headers in _darkmode.conf_ means more things to edit when we change version numbers.  I rather not go there.

title: White lines and white MAP_FRAME_PEN don't go along.
